alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Prince Edward, northern Lunenburg and southwestern Nottoway Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keysville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lunenburg around 500 PM EDT. Victoria around 505 PM EDT. Kenbridge around 510 PM EDT. Blackstone and Dundas around 520 PM EDT. Fort Barfoot around 530 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Irby, Briery, Arvins Store, Murdocks, Forkland, Nutbush, Scholfield, The Falls, Pleasant Grove and Dominy Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Virginia.
